page.title: 01FREELAND & CHURCH HANBOROUGH
page.content:
The area which we surveyed is rural and mostly agricultural, and contains two villages, the larger of which is Freeland, and the smaller Church Hanborough. There is also a tiny hamlet called Barnard Gate in the SW corner of our area. Our school is in Eynsham, to the south, and to carry out our survey we had to cross the A40 trunk road which forms the southern boundary of the area. This is a busy main road which forms the route from London and Oxford to the Cotswolds and North Wales.
Many people living here work in Oxford and Witney, or on local farms. We decided to find out about the lives of children of our own age, and about the institutions and some of the work that people do, especially on the land.
